text: all: "Mack Chat."
The court will come to order.

- Order! Order!
- Ahem.
All rise for "Mack Chat."

- This court is in session.
- ( music playing )
It's time to recap the "Mack."

- Let's recap the "Mack." 
- Hey.

Boy: So Buffy goes to the
doctor, and she finds out

that she has a stress fracture
in her foot.

- It's a stress fracture.
- First question was like,

"Can you still play basketball?"
And she's like, "Yeah.

- I can still play basketball."
- Next season.
( sad trombone )

So TJ pulls up
with this golf cart

because he sees
Buffy struggling

to get across
the football field to class.
Giving you a ride to class.

It was really nice of him
to bring up the golf cart

and let her go in so she
wouldn't be late for class.

TJ, a complaint has been filed
against you
for grand theft golf cart.

I was kinda sad because he was
just trying to do
the right thing.

I was really nervous for him,
especially when they were
determining his punishment.

- Lunchtime detention on Monday.
- Whoo.

- What's going on?
- We're having our end of season
  party.

When Buffy was at her house,
the basketball team
surprised her

by throwing a big
last game party,

even though they still had
one more game to go.

You close your eyes
when you shoot.

She gave every teammate
a correction,

and she gave everybody playbooks
and then during the game,

- she actually helped them.
- I'm so proud of you guys!

- You did it.
- I need you to stop coming
  to The Spoon.

- I understand that Amber
  needed space.
- Oh.

I'd be very sad and I'd just go
in there anyway.

I think she feels so emotional,
so it makes her just feel
really sad.

Nobody tips
a bummed out waitress.

When Andi is apprehensive
at submitting her application
to SAVA,

- Jonah just pops up...
- Boo!

"Hey, what are you doing?"
And Andi says,

- "I have to make a decision."
- About what?

- I don't want to tell you.
- If you wanted to say yes,

you wouldn't be asking me
this question.

I think he should have known
first what it was about

because that's a really big
decision about the next four
years of her life.

Girl: When Andi looked
at her computer,

it said it was
already submitted.

- Uh-oh.
- Oh, no.
I was just like freaked out.

She didn't have to decide
anymore and the decision
was over

and it was made for her,
which was probably by fate.

- I did it.
- Nobody tips a bummed out
  waitress.

"Bummed Out Waitress Tips,"
with Emily Skinner.

What do you think are the best
things to do to get over
a breakup?

Order pizza
and maybe sing karaoke.

Karaoke is a good way
to heal.

My boyfriend Jonah here
is not giving me the attention
I deserve.

Okay, ever thought you were
being too clingy?

- ( chuckles ) Whoa.
- Who needs a boyfriend or
  a girlfriend anyway?

If you're going through
a breakup, I would really try
and talk to someone.

Now it doesn't have to be
a random person from The Spoon.

- It could be anyone.
- Yeah, never good to bottle it
  up, you gotta let it out.

- Exactly.
- Better to stay single.
No drama.
Quiet in the court, please.

This is another episode
of "Mack Trial."
"Mack Trial Round 2."

We are here now gathered
to try and figure out

what the real verdict
of TJ should be.

Should he be punished
for his actions?

Or merely let off with a warning
because he did the right thing?

- ( tires squealing ) 
- He is not guilty.

Because he could have taken it
to just feel the breeze.
Like maybe he was very angry.

He was only trying to help
someone--

Oh, he's helping someone?
Who was he helping?

- Buffy.
- I just got passed
  by a caterpillar.

Anti TJ,
I want to hear your side.
TJ is guilty on all charges.

Who gave him permission
to steal a golf cart?

'Cause I sure didn't.
The coach sure didn't.

He should have asked the P.E.
teacher first, understood?

- I object.
- The P.E. teacher would have
  said no.

The P.E. teacher wasn't even
there at the time.

Helping a friend is definitely
a reasonable thing to do,

but stealing a golf cart
is pretty uncalled for,

- especially without permission.
- That's rough.

What do you guys think
his punishment should be?

- He should be suspended.
- I'll just wait for you to make
  the right decision.

Verdict, TJ is sentenced
to one lunch detention.

- Oh, my gosh!
- Order! Order!

- I'm the bailiff,
  and I'm here to arrest.
- I object!

- I object to that objection!
- You close your eyes
  when you shoot.
"Blindfold Basketball."
all: "Blindfold basketball"!
( clamoring )
Okay, Zoey.
( cheering )
You made it!
( cheering )
( music playing )
( cheering )
I made it!
( cheering )
I'm so proud of you guys.

Time to predict
what happens next.

I think Andi
will get into SAVA.

- Okay.
- With her art and all her
  crafts that she's made,

I think she definitely
will get into Sava.

And if they don't accept her
they're missing out.
♪ Hey ♪
♪ All the way ♪
